physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Neurological examination revealed head and trunk tremors, cognitive dysfunctions, bilateral gaze-evoked nystagmus, and cerebellar ataxia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, the patient presented with disturbance of consciousness and other symptoms which improved after initial treatment, but cognitive impairment persisted. Seven months later, the patient showed progressive neurological symptoms.

physical_examinations.date: Three months after second admission (not specified)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: CSF analysis remained unchanged during the second admission.
